856367036:
[

Senior Associate - Real Estate

Company Name MinterEllison Company Location Melbourne, AU

New Posted Date Posted 6 hours ago Number of views 2 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

About Us

MinterEllison is an international law firm, headquartered in Australia and regarded as one of Asia-Pacific's premier law firms. Our teams collaborate across Australia, New Zealand, Asia and the UK to deliver exceptional service.

We have a clear goal – to be our clients' best partner. We put the client at the centre of everything we do and partner with them to deliver truly innovative solutions.

We also think beyond the law, offering clients advisers who are multi-disciplinary and industry-facing to help them achieve strategic goals, grasp business opportunities and create value for their stakeholders.

OUR TEAM

The Melbourne REEP team is a large, collegiate team with a commitment to achieving excellence in all that we do. When working on matters, we aim to see the world through our clients' eyes, to intimately understand the nuances of the deal, the many issues and complexities it presents and how best to solve for these.

Our clients are sophisticated and savvy, ranging from developers, investors, owners, landlords, property fund managers through to governments and statutory bodies both local and international. We work collaboratively and seamlessly with our colleagues across MinterEllison's many practice groups and offices, especially Tax, Finance, M&A and commercial litigation. We love what we do and take pride in the quality of the service and support we deliver.

YOUR ROLE

A great opportunity has arisen for a senior lawyer to assist leading a large team dealing with the full spectrum of real estate law. The work will span capital transactions (including acquisitions, disposals, due diligence and volume conveyancing), leasing (for many of Australia's leading landlords and tenants including both major one-off leases and volume leasing work on national property portfolios), property development and asset management strategies. Our client base has grown significantly in recent times and we need a proactive person with strong experience to meet demands.

What You Need

We welcome applications from people who
  • have at least 5 years of post-admission experience;
  • collaborate to deliver innovative solutions and ensure the best outcome is achieved for the client;
  • continually contribute to the growth and success of the firm; and
  • inspire others through their commitment to personal growth, innovation and the delivery of exceptional results.


What We Offer

Our diverse and talented teams enjoy a culture of collaboration, innovation and inspiring others. We are committed to your career development by leveraging the unique strengths you bring to the team and building your capabilities and business acumen to take you to the next level faster.

We care about ensuring you balance your professional goals with your commitments and interests outside of work, and provide a wide range of social, financial and health benefits to support your wellbeing. Our internal support teams are second to none and will help you perform at your best each day.

How To Apply

We prefer to deal with your directly so please submit your CV, cover letter and academic transcripts for consideration by clicking on the 'Apply' button below. If you would like further information please contact Lisa Fleming on 61 7 3119 6460 for a confidential discussion.

Please note that applications from agencies will not be considered at this time. To be eligible to apply for this role you must be legally permitted to work in Australia.

Industry

  • Law Practice
  • Legal Services

Employment Type

Full-time

Job Functions

  • Sales
  • Management

Group Manager, Contracts and Commercial Services

Company Name Monash University Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 126 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Job No.:\xa0581619


Location:\xa0Clayton campus


Employment Type:\xa0Full-time


Duration:\xa012 month fixed-term appointment


Remuneration:\xa0HEW 10A - Base salary of $141,012 per annum plus 17% superannuation and an annual incentive payment of up to a maximum of 10%


  • Be inspired, every day
  • Enjoy the freedom to discover something new
  • Take your career in exciting, rewarding directions


There’s a certain feeling you get from working at Monash University. It’s the feeling that you’re a part of something special. Something significant. So if you’re looking for the next chapter in your career, it’s here. You’ll be given the opportunity to challenge yourself, build on your skills, and make a significant contribution to a workplace that’s filled with energetic and inspiring people. Talent thrives here – and so do truly satisfying careers.


The Opportunity


An opportunity now exists for an experienced Group Manager to lead the high performing Contracts and Commercial Services team who manage the optimization of supplier relationships, in line with Monash’s strategic direction. The Group Manager is an integral member to the Contracts and Commercial Services area and broader eSolutions’ leadership team. In this position, you will be in charge of leading and mentoring a specialist team to develop, implement, manage and adapt sourcing strategies and processes in support of the latest market trends and conditions.


Utilising your strategic vision and business acumen, you will drive performance and embed new ways of working through continuous application of best practise through the implementation of a supplier base management framework. Approaching this focus with a mind-set of innovation, you will ensure the use and education of best practice procurement methodologies, adherence to legislative, probity and contractual obligations and subsequently the enablement of the University to retain its competitive edge.


A collaborative and detail-orientated senior leader, you will be well versed in managing all aspects of large, complex and organisational-wide business change, thought leadership and delivery assurance of functions, teams and strategies. You will have a strong background in executive management to compliment your well-rounded experience in commercial management and the end-to-end delivery of procurement strategies and processes.


You will manage the interface between eSolutions and core, high-profile client groups. As such, the successful incumbent will be well-versed in driving engagement with senior and executive stakeholders, including the ability to manage and negotiate to achieve maximum leverage and competitive solutions.


This is a brilliant opportunity for a driven individual to showcase their highly developed skills in a rewarding and high performing environment. If this sounds like a position that suits your current career focus we look forward to hearing from you!

This role is a 12 month fixed-term position, with the potential opportunity to extend this, dependent upon business requirements.


Click on the "Apply on company website" button above for the full position description and instructions on how to apply for Monash jobs. .


Enquiries

Ms Anna Cakal, Group Manager, Delivery Transformation, +61 447 560 714.


Closing Date

Tuesday 18 September 2018, 11:55 pm AEST

Job description

The role:


Located in Melbourne - As our Business Development Manager for Victoria,\xa0you will shape and grow the Verve brand and product. You will excel at strategic planning, negotiation, relationship building, and overcoming obstacles in a fast-paced environment. Your analytical skills will assess new business opportunities, and your entrepreneurial and creative spirit will tap into new markets to form lasting partnerships and new business.


\xa0

You are:


Experienced: You’ve worked in a BDM role for 3+ years, and know what it takes to grow and drive lasting partnerships from beginning to finish. Experience within a creative, artistic or retail environment gets a big tick.


A negotiator: You excel at negotiating and closing sound commercial agreements while possessing an understanding of contracts, agreements and sales best practices.

An enthusiast for all things creative: Your love of art, design, photography and all things creative is what drives and excites you, whether that’s during company time or your personal time.


A communicator: You can communicate across all platforms: presentations, emails, conference calls, meetings and events. You’re able to successfully promote our brand and products in a clear and exciting way, to a plethora of audiences.


An entrepreneurial spirit: You don't need a lot of instructions - you make and believe in your own decisions. You operate as a responsible person who delivers on-time, and treats Verve's business, as your own business.


A report guru: You love to generate reports and provide analysis using Excel and Powerpoint. You are capable of translating raw data into insightful reports and presentations that are clear and concise for management.


You will:

  • Prospect and develop new business channel partners for our brand and product.
  • Drive partner engagement and encourage loyalty from partners by creating and evolving a loyalty plan.
  • Effectively manage client relationships, engagement and feedback.
  • Provide insightful reporting on sales, revenue, conversions, risks and feedback.
  • Meet monthly and quarterly sales targets by creating leads to deliver revenue.
  • Partner closely with our Marketing, Sales and Production departments to achieve operational and customer success.


We offer:

  • Competitive Salary and Bonus Structure.
  • A fun, dynamic and caring workplace culture.
  • An awesome Annual Gala to reward and celebrate our achievements.
  • An exhilarating workforce of 150+ creatives
  • We value diversity in all forms.


To Apply Visit:


https://verveportraits.com.au/careers/\xa0

Principle Quality Engineer – Automation

Company Name National Australia Bank Company Location Melbourne

New Posted Date Posted 11 hours ago Number of views 11 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Quality, automation and strategic focus
  • Permanent full time opportunity
  • Sydney location

At NAB Wealth, we believe success comes from our people. We're committed to supporting your talent and skills through your career, as you help us build a culture that creates change for our customers and for the community.


If you're always thinking about what's possible, we want to hear from you.


As part of a specialist Quality Engineering team you will work across all disciplines to enable and transform quality practices within NAB Wealth platform and project teams.


Innovate with new and existing tools, processes, practices and industrialise them into a regular delivery cycle agnostic of delivery methodology.\xa0 Identify required resource needs specific to each engagement. Work to define and influence the ongoing Quality Engineering solution process for all delivery engagements.


In this role you will also be responsible for:


  • Drive an Automation led approach for system, SIT and unit testing across NAB Wealth, and contribute to platform integration and performance tests.
  • Implement & monitor quality metrics including trend analysis of discrepancies and defects; drive investigations into problems and correction actions relating to recurring problems.
  • Proactively manage risk; meet all policy and compliance requirements; perform controls; adhere to Process and Procedures pertinent to role.
  • Innovate and embed Quality Engineering practices.
  • Manage and lead teams in Quality Engineering.
  • Create and review solution documentation.
  • Drive a learning-based culture.

To be successful in this role you must have the below skills and experience:


  • 7+ years of relevant software development, solution architecture and/or quality engineering experience in multiple environments
  • Minimum of 5 years’ experience in Quality Engineering - Automation
  • Experience leading integrated teams to ensure systems are designed for reliability, performance and testability.
  • Experience in strategic development and implementation of Quality Engineering solutions (Automation Frameworks, Performance Validation etc)
  • Proven thought leader & trusted advisor
  • Technical acumen in technologies associated with complex and deeply integrated systems eg: e2e domain, business logic and technology (framework/service architecture)
  • Expert with CI/CD, TDD, BDD
  • Expert in Quality Engineering tools such as: QTest, Jenkins, Git, Github, \xa0Jira, Confluence, Selenium, Perfecto, SOAP UI, CA Lisa, SQL, Jmeter, Rest services, Jenkins pipeline management

To be eligible to apply, you must be an Australian / New Zealand citizen or hold permanent residency status in Australia and be a Nab payrolled employee.\xa0\xa0


We embrace diversity of thought, style and working arrangements to ensure our workforce is representative of the community that we serve.


For full job details and to apply go to nab.com.au/careers

Your new company

Your new role
 The role involves identifying new business opportunities, Business to Business Sales, creating opportunities to tender, negotiating contracts and providing technical expertise to customers.  To be a successful candidate, you will be a strategic thinker who has experience in consultative solution sales, targeting C-Level decision makers within all size organisations. You have a passion for serving and understanding customers whilst being a strategic thinker that can see beyond the day-to-day grind to help reach marketing and sales goals, create a stronger brand and improve the customer experience.

As an experience marketing communications practitioner, you have a passion for serving and understanding customers whilst being a strategic thinker that can see beyond the day-to-day grind to help reach marketing and sales goals, create a stronger brand and improve the customer experience.
